post_text:
On August 13, 2020, the Wythe County School Board approved a plan to move the start date of the 2020/2021 school year to Tuesday, September 8, 2020. Additionally, beginning September 8, WCPS will move to a 100% virtual instruction model for all students. The 100% virtual instruction will last until October 26, 2020, which was the identified date for the end of the first quarter on the 2020/2021 school calendar. No other changes were made to the 2020/2021 school calendar. The Wythe County School Board will receive an update at their regularly scheduled meeting on September 10, 2020, and will determine if any changes need to be made beyond the action that was taken today. More detailed information regarding the 100% virtual instruction plan for WCPS will be provided to students and families in the very near future. Please stay tuned.

Scott L. Jefferies, Ed.D.
Superintendent
Wythe County Public Schools
text:

No other changes were made to the 2020/2021 school calendar. The Wythe County School Board will receive an update at their regularly scheduled meeting on September 10, 2020, and will determine if any changes need to be made beyond the action that was taken today. More detailed information regarding the 100% virtual instruction plan for WCPS will be provided to students and families in the very near future. Please stay tuned.

post_text: WCPS Return-To-Learning Updates
text: WCPS Return-To-Learning Updates

post_text: Good evening. Student Registration Part 2 is now available on our Wythe County Public School website. You must create a Parent Portal account to proceed with Part 2 of the registration process. All 2020 - 2021 registration papers are now required to be filled out electronically. If you have not created a Parent Portal account, please contact your child's school as soon as possible. In addition, you will receive a mailing in the next few days detailing the Hybrid or Digital Learning environment plan you selected for your child on the Student Registration Part 1 a couple weeks ago. The letter will also have important information regarding your child's Return to Learning Plan for the fall semester. Please don't hesitate to contact your child's school if you have any questions or concerns after receiving this information in the mail. Thank you.
text: Good evening. Student Registration Part 2 is now available on our Wythe County Public School website. You must create a Parent Portal account to proceed with Part 2 of the registration process. All 2020 - 2021 registration papers are now required to be filled out electronically. If you have not created a Parent Portal account, please contact your child's school as soon as possible. In addition, you will receive a mailing in the next few days detailing the Hybrid or Digital Learning environment plan you selected for your child on the Student Registration Part 1 a couple weeks ago. The letter will also have important information regarding your child's Return to Learning Plan for the fall semester. Please don't hesitate to contact your child's school if you have any questions or concerns after receiving this information in the mail. Thank you.

post_text:
In accordance with the order from Governor Ralph Northam, Wythe County Public Schools will be closed for the remainder of this school year.
More information will be provided in the next few days regarding graduation, credits, GPA and the continuity of learning.
We appreciate your patience and understanding during these unprecedented times. Thank you.

post_text: WCPS Coronavirus update
text: WCPS Coronavirus update

post_text: Good Evening. Teachers have worked hard this week to provide students, parents, and guardians access to online learning materials. Please visit the W C P S web page https://wythe.k12.va.us/ and click on the WCPS At-Home Learning Plan to access these materials. The link will connect you to our PK-12 student resources and activities for instruction at home. Teachers will add new activities on a weekly basis as long as schools are closed. If you have difficulty accessing these materials on our website, please contact your child's school. Students, parents, and guardians may email teachers, counselors, and administration for any educational assistance during the extended state-wide school closing. We really appreciate all of our teachers and the efforts they initiated to provide continuity of learning opportunities for our students. We are also grateful to our families for investing a portion of our time off, to keep students' minds sharp while we are required to close our schools. Thank You.
text: Good Evening. Teachers have worked hard this week to provide students, parents, and guardians access to online learning materials. Please visit the W C P S web page https://wythe.k12.va.us/ and click on the WCPS At-Home Learning Plan to access these materials. The link will connect you to our PK-12 student resources and activities for instruction at home. Teachers will add new activities on a weekly basis as long as schools are closed. If you have difficulty accessing these materials on our website, please contact your child's school. Students, parents, and guardians may email teachers, counselors, and administration for any educational assistance during the extended state-wide school closing. We really appreciate all of our teachers and the efforts they initiated to provide continuity of learning opportunities for our students. We are also grateful to our families for investing a portion of our time off, to keep students' minds sharp while we are required to close our schools. Thank You.

post_text: Wythe County Public Schools are committed to providing at-home learning experiences for students during the extended division-wide school closing. As a result, we have created an At-Home Learning Resource Plan to ensure the continuation of learning experiences at home. We have included our plan in the link below so families can understand and support learning at home during our time out of school. Students, parents and guardians may email teachers, counselors, and administration for any educational assistance during the extended division-wide school closing. If you do not have access to email or other electronic means for learning, please contact your child's school.

If you do not have access to email or other electronic means for learning, please contact your child's school.

Wythe County Public Schools
March 12, 2018 at 12:06 PM ¬∑

Wythe County Public Schools

Pre-K Application &

Kindergarten Registration Week

Tuesday, April 3 ‚Äì Friday, April 6, 2018

Pre-K Applications and Kindergarten Registration for the 2018 ‚Äì 2019 school year will be accepted during the week of April 3 - 6, 2018
in each Wythe County Elementary School.

Parents may apply or register their child any day that week from 9:30 a.m. until 3:30 p.m. An Open House will be held at each elementary school on Tuesday, April 3, 2018 from 4:00 p.m. to 6:30 p.m. School staff and local private Pre-K center staff will be available to answer questions.

Additional information is available in the attached documents: Kindergarten Registration Overview and the Pre-K Application Week Overview. A Pre-K application is also attached.

post_text:
Revised WCPS Calendar

The revised 2017-18 WCPS School Calendar is attached. Here are the noteworthy events about the most recent revisions:

* Snow day # 10 will now be made up on Memorial Day, May 28. 2018.
* Report Cards will now go out on April 6.
* 4th Nine-week mid-term reports will now go home on May 3.
*WCPS Division-wide step-up day will be held May 29.
*The non-writing SOL Testing window has been moved to accommodate the recently missed school days. The non-writing SOL testing window is now May 2 - May 30.
*The last day of school will remain on May 31, 2018.

post_text: The Wythe County Public Schools will conduct a community forum on December 11 at 6:00 p.m. at the School Board Office to provide the community with an opportunity to comment on the George Wythe High School renovation project. This will provide community members with an opportunity to ask questions, to offer suggestions, and to provide thoughts on what they want to see with the renovation project. Staff, students, parents, and community members are welcome to attend.

For more information about SchoolMessenger, access under parent resources on the Wythe County website or use the link below.

post_text: We discovered a threat which was written on a bathroom stall at Fort Chiswell High School. The threat indicated that there would be a shooting at Fort Chiswell High School today. We take every threat of this nature seriously but we do not feel that this is a legitimate safety concern. We have extra law enforcement officers present at Fort Chiswell High School & Fort Chiswell Middle School. We intend on having school today and we feel that all students and staff will be safe.
text: We discovered a threat which was written on a bathroom stall at Fort Chiswell High School. The threat indicated that there would be a shooting at Fort Chiswell High School today. We take every threat of this nature seriously but we do not feel that this is a legitimate safety concern. We have extra law enforcement officers present at Fort Chiswell High School & Fort Chiswell Middle School. We intend on having school today and we feel that all students and staff will be safe.

post_text: During the community forum on September 21, several of the leaders wanted to have a follow-up meeting. These individuals wanted to identify ways in which they could positively address the removal of the prayer plaque at Spiller. We will hold a leadership meeting on October 4 at 12:00 p.m. at the School Board Office. We are providing an open invitation to all ministers, pastors, and other local primary church leaders to join us for lunch on October 4. The purpose of this meeting is to discuss ways in which local church memberships can have a positive and constructive partnership with the school division. We are asking all church leaders to contact Mrs. Blankenship at 276-228-5411 if you plan on attending so we can prepare lunches. This meeting is specifically designed for the primary leader in your church. We hope to see our local church leaders on this date. Please contact us if you have any questions.

post_text: Tonight's community forum will be moved to the George Wythe High School auditorium. We want to ensure that we have sufficient room for those who wish to attend.
text: Tonight's community forum will be moved to the George Wythe High School auditorium. We want to ensure that we have sufficient room for those who wish to attend.

post_text: We will hold a community forum on September 21 at 6:00 p.m. to take concerns about the removal of the prayer plaque at Spiller Elementary School. The meeting will be held in the school board office. During this meeting, we will provide community members with an explanation of the law and why we made the decision to take down the plaque. We will also give community members an opportunity to express their concerns and to ask questions. We are holding this forum to ensure community members have an opportunity to talk with us and to ask questions. We understand it is sometimes frustrating for community members to speak during a regular board meeting because we only take comments during our meeting. We normally don't respond to questions during public comment in a regular meeting. However, this community forum on September 21 will allow us to have meaningful conversations with members of the community. We want to make sure that our parents and community members feel that they have been heard and we respond to their questions.
text: We will hold a community forum on September 21 at 6:00 p.m. to take concerns about the removal of the prayer plaque at Spiller Elementary School. The meeting will be held in the school board office. During this meeting, we will provide community members with an explanation of the law and why we made the decision to take down the plaque. We will also give community members an opportunity to express their concerns and to ask questions. We are holding this forum to ensure community members have an opportunity to talk with us and to ask questions. We understand it is sometimes frustrating for community members to speak during a regular board meeting because we only take comments during our meeting. We normally don't respond to questions during public comment in a regular meeting. However, this community forum on September 21 will allow us to have meaningful conversations with members of the community. We want to make sure that our parents and community members feel that they have been heard and we respond to their questions.

post_text: The Wythe County School Board welcomes students back to school!! #backtoschoolVA
text: The Wythe County School Board welcomes students back to school!! #backtoschoolVA

post_text: School starts back for students on August 9! Please watch for school buses and children as they travel from home to school and back to the house. It takes parents and school officials a period of time to work with our smaller students on how to be safe when waiting for a bus or walking home. Please be extra vigilant when traveling by a bus stop area or school campus. Also, watch carefully for bus lights and obey all state laws about not passing a school bus when the lights are active. We hope it is a great first day for you and your child.
text: School starts back for students on August 9! Please watch for school buses and children as they travel from home to school and back to the house. It takes parents and school officials a period of time to work with our smaller students on how to be safe when waiting for a bus or walking home. Please be extra vigilant when traveling by a bus stop area or school campus. Also, watch carefully for bus lights and obey all state laws about not passing a school bus when the lights are active. We hope it is a great first day for you and your child.

post_text:
Wythe County Public School Parents:

Please fill out all of your medical forms that are found on the Wythe County Public School's website. Simply click on Departments and Services and then select Health Services or use the link below. All of the medical forms should be printed, filled out, and returned to your school nurse on parent visitation night. Please make sure to fill out the Care Docs permission form also found on the website. You can update your student's health information through Care Docs and your school nurse can communicate with you through this site.

Please use the link below to access all forms.

post_text:
We have installed the upgraded mitigation system for radon at Spiller Elementary School and it is fully operational. We finished the installation of a new radon mitigation system at Speedwell Elementary School yesterday and are in the process of testing. We should receive the results back into 3 -4 weeks.

We received the numbers back from Spiller Elementary School after we implemented the mitigation system. All numbers at Spiller came back under the required level for any type of action. The mitigation system seems to be working great. We fully anticipate the system at Speedwell will produce the same results. The following are the numbers for Spiller Elementary.

We continue to conduct routine testing throughout our schools and we will take care of any safety issues immediately when discovered.

Room 241 3.1 pCi/L
Room 247 2.9 pCi/L
Room 249 2.8 pCi/L

Joint Board Work Session

The WCPS School Board and Wythe County Board of Supervisors will hold a joint capital improvement work session on Thursday, February 9 at 6:00 p.m. The work session will take place at the county administration office. There is not an opportunity for public comment during a work session. Public comments can be made during regularly scheduled board meetings.
text:
Joint Board Work Session

The WCPS School Board and Wythe County Board of Supervisors will hold a joint capital improvement work session on Thursday, February 9 at 6:00 p.m. The work session will take place at the county administration office. There is not an opportunity for public comment during a work session. Public comments can be made during regularly scheduled board meetings.

post_text: Due to high winds, we experienced some issues with the gym roof at George Wythe High School. We have cancelled the basketball games scheduled for tonight as a precautionary measure and we anticipate that we will be able to have school tomorrow. We will inspect the roof tomorrow and take the necessary course of action if we deem anything unsafe. However, we don't anticipate any structural issues other than rubber membrane.
text: Due to high winds, we experienced some issues with the gym roof at George Wythe High School. We have cancelled the basketball games scheduled for tonight as a precautionary measure and we anticipate that we will be able to have school tomorrow. We will inspect the roof tomorrow and take the necessary course of action if we deem anything unsafe. However, we don't anticipate any structural issues other than rubber membrane.

post_text:
College Night at Fort Chiswell High School:
Join us on February 9th at 6:00 p.m. in the Fort Chiswell High School Cafeteria for College Night. At this free event, you will learn about college admissions, the financial aid process, scholarships and other college-related topics. There will be pizza, college admission representatives, and a drawing for three $500.00 scholarships.

post_text: The Wythe County School Board will conduct a community forum on February 2 at 6:00 p.m. at the George Wythe High School Auditorium to share information on the school division‚Äôs capital improvement plan. Community members and staff will also have an opportunity to ask questions about the plan and to clarify any issues they may have concerning our building program. We encourage all community members and staff to attend.

post_text: Wythe County Public Schools will be operating on a two hour delay Wednesday, January 11

post_text: Schools will be closed on Tuesday, January 10
text: Schools will be closed on Tuesday, January 10

post_text: We are always searching for ways to better communicate with our community. We will hold a series of community chats from 4:30 p.m. to 5:30 p.m. on the second Thursday during the months of our evening board meetings. It is our thought to have these meetings immediately before our regular board meeting to prevent another evening meeting after school. This will be an opportunity for community members and parents to come out and share ideas, thoughts, ask questions and provide suggestions for improvement. We want to keep it extremely informal and be more of a conversation or chat with school officials as opposed to a more formal meeting. Our next community chat will be on Thursday, January 12 at 4:30 p.m. in the school board office board room.

post_text: After careful review of road conditions, no changes will be made to today's school schedule.
text: After careful review of road conditions, no changes will be made to today's school schedule.

post_text:
Congratulations to Nick Martin, Scott Memorial Middle School student, for being selected to serve in the Virginia General Assembly Page Program. We are extremely proud of Nick!

Congratulations to the Fort Chiswell High School Choir. They were selected to perform as the opening act for the Virginia School Board Association State Conference. They did an excellent job and we were so proud to see Wythe County Students perform at such an important event.

It is that time of year when inclement weather may require us to modify our school schedule. Please make sure you have provided the school with updated contact information so we can send you Honeywell Messages to alert you of these changes. Also, we will post changes of our school schedule on our Facebook account. Keep informed!

Our last day of school before winter break will be December 20 with a noon dismissal. We return back to school on January 4, 2017.

post_text: The Santa Shop/Operation St. Nick will be holding a fundraiser dinner on October 6, 2016 at the Wytheville Moose Lodge. The dinner will begin at 6:00 pm and entertainment will be provided by the George Wythe High School Choir. Please join us for an evening of fun and food. All proceeds will be used to help provide toys to deserving children in the Wythe and Bland County areas. Tickets are $15 each and can be purchased at Three Rivers Media, Wythe County Department of Social Services, George Wythe High School, or call 276-920-9424.

All proceeds will be used to help provide toys to deserving children in the Wythe and Bland County areas. Tickets are $15 each and can be purchased at Three Rivers Media, Wythe County Department of Social Services, George Wythe High School, or call 276-920-9424.

post_text: The Wythe County Public Schools were placed on modified lock-down today for a short period of time. The Wythe County Sheriff‚Äôs office notified us that a potentially dangerous suspect had made comments that he was going to pick up his child at school. At that time, the Sheriff‚Äôs office was unaware of which school the child was enrolled. We went on modified lock-down in all schools as a precaution. The suspect has been apprehended and we are back on regular schedule. All staff and students are safe and we are back to the normal day.

post_text: This chart demonstrates the amount of growth that school divisions within Region VII has made from last year to this year. We are identified as Division 1. We have made over 200% growth from last year and we have far exceeded the amount of growth by any other school division within Region VII.
text: This chart demonstrates the amount of growth that school divisions within Region VII has made from last year to this year. We are identified as Division 1. We have made over 200% growth from last year and we have far exceeded the amount of growth by any other school division within Region VII.

post_text: We have many positive accomplishments to highlight. First, we are extremely proud that all schools within Wythe County are fully accredited! This is the first time in many years that all schools are accredited. Second, we have seen growth in every subgroup and category that we measure. This chart demonstrates that we have more students passing, more special education students passing, more economically disadvantaged students passing, more students with advanced scores, more teachers with 100% of their students passing, etc. Regardless if it is our most academically able students, or our most academically challenged students, ‚Äì we are seeing tremendous growth!

post_text:
One of the top priorities of the Wythe County Public Schools is to increase academic performance. It is our goal to be one of the top ten academic performing schools in the Commonwealth by next year. We are confident we have the necessary administration, staff, and students to accomplish this goal.

Although we look at a variety of data points to measure our academic success - our performance on state mandated assessments (Standard of Learning or SOLs) is an important factor to consider. The following charts demonstrate the success we have made from last year to this year. As the data indicates, we have made significant progress in virtually every area. There are three areas where we didn‚Äôt experience growth but we have already addressed those issues and we are confident we will see better results next year. All other areas saw incredible growth with many having double-digit increases.
